title: Retail gold, silver bulls to face Sunday blues
summary: Many traders who rushed into gold and silver fearing they would miss the rally saw their capital wiped out in a single day as unfavourable global cues triggered an unprecedented plunge in metal prices.

title: Gold, silver crash up to 30%: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath shares a key takeaway from commodity market rout
summary: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warns investors after a shocking 30% drop in silver and 15% in gold. He stresses the importance of trading only with money you can afford to lose, especially in volatile markets where traditional risk management fails.&nbsp;

title: How to trade on Budget 2026 date? Guide for Nifty, Sensex, gold and silver investors; eight stocks to buy or sell
summary: Budget 2026 date: The Indian stock market will remain open on Sunday whereas the commodity market will remain open from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM

title: EM Assets Pare Monthly Rally on Slump in Metals, Trump Fed Pick
summary: Emerging market assets are falling for a second straight session on Friday, paring their monthly gains, as metals plunge and the dollar surges to its best day since July after President Donald Trump announced his pick for the top job at the Federal Reserve.
text: EM Assets Pare Monthly Rally on Slump in Metals, Trump Fed Pick Emerging market assets are falling for a second straight session on Friday, paring their monthly gains, as metals plunge and the dollar surges to its best day since July after President Donald Trump announced his pick for the top job at the Federal Reserve.

title: Gold rates today: MCX gold crashes  ₹15,200 per 10g, silver plunges  ₹72,000 per kg on firm US dollar
summary: Gold and silver faced heavy selling on 30 January due to a strong US dollar and profit-taking after record highs. Silver dropped 20%, while gold fell 9%. The market reacted to President Trump's Fed chair nomination, raising concerns over policy easing. Both metals, however, still show January gains.
text: Gold rates today: MCX gold crashes  ₹15,200 per 10g, silver plunges  ₹72,000 per kg on firm US dollar Gold and silver faced heavy selling on 30 January due to a strong US dollar and profit-taking after record highs. Silver dropped 20%, while gold fell 9%. The market reacted to President Trump's Fed chair nomination, raising concerns over policy easing. Both metals, however, still show January gains.

title: Rupee rebounds from record low of 92.02 to end marginally higher against US dollar
summary: At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 91.89 and gained ground, touching 91.82 against the greenback during intraday trade. The currency touched its lowest-ever level of 92.02 before ending the session at 91.97 against the dollar.
text: Rupee rebounds from record low of 92.02 to end marginally higher against US dollar At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 91.89 and gained ground, touching 91.82 against the greenback during intraday trade. The currency touched its lowest-ever level of 92.02 before ending the session at 91.97 against the dollar.

title: Trump picks a reinvented Kevin Warsh to lead the Federal Reserve
summary: President Donald Trump said he intends to nominate Kevin Warsh to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve, according to a post on his Truth Social platform.

summary: India's inflation basket gets its biggest update in over a decade, with food weight falling sharply and miscellaneous split into multiple divisions.

title: Netflix, Uber, smartphones: The items entering India's retail inflation basket
summary: India will shift to a new Consumer Price Index series with 2024 as the base year from 12 February 2026, after an expert group recommended a comprehensive overhaul to reflect changing household consumption patterns, new services, and global best practices in inflation measurement.
text: Netflix, Uber, smartphones: The items entering India's retail inflation basket India will shift to a new Consumer Price Index series with 2024 as the base year from 12 February 2026, after an expert group recommended a comprehensive overhaul to reflect changing household consumption patterns, new services, and global best practices in inflation measurement.
